name: Diner-Style Patty Melt
author: thedailygourmet
summary: These patty melts are quick to put together, and are better than a diner because they're not nearly as greasy!
directions: Heat butter and oil in a Dutch oven
Add onions, season with salt and pepper, cook, stirring continually, for 3 minutes
Cover with a lid and allow onions to caramelize, stirring occasionally to prevent burning, about 20 minutes
Meanwhile, combine ground beef, garlic salt, and pepper in a bowl and mix thoroughly
Shape ground beef into 4 rectangular patties
Cook patties in a skillet over medium-high heat, flipping once, 3 to 4 minutes per side
Add a slice of Swiss cheese to each patty and top each with an equal amount of caramelized onions
Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler
Spread 1 teaspoon butter over each slice of bread
Broil until lightly golden and toasted
Assemble patty melts and serve immediately
